snippet: A ban in Kerala state on a school’s staging of “Jesus Christ Superstar” dating to 1990 has been lifted, though no productions are now scheduled.
abstract: India's Supreme Court decides to permit staging of Andrew Lloyd Webber rock opera Jesus Christ Superstar in Kottayam district of Kerala state, 25 years after show was outlawed there to prevent offending religious sensibilities; ban was supposed to be temporary, but stretched over two decades.
lead_paragraph: A ban in Kerala state on a school’s staging of “Jesus Christ Superstar” dating to 1990 has been lifted, though no productions are now scheduled.

headline.main: After a Quarter-Century of Legal Wrangling in India, a Rock Opera Can Go On
headline.print_headline: After 25-Year Court Case, Indian Show Can Go On
